testcase.brief: CVG is wan only, BR is wan nat, the CVG and BR are all behind NAT
testcase.description:
Pre-Condition:
-config CVG with WAN interface, nat disable no interface ethx mode wan nat -config CVG act as l3 VPN server -one LAN on CVG -config BR with WAN interface, nat enable -config BR as l3 VPN client -one LAN on BR -both BR and CVG are behind a FW -traffic from wan of CVG can reach wan of BR, the LANs are unreachable from each other -clock time sync with BR/CVG
Test Procedure:
-check the status of vpn connection -check Ike sa and sp is correct on both CVG and BR sides -check the tunnel interface created after vpn connection success -check the l3 tunnel created correctly on both sides -check the ip of mgt0 is added to the peer via tunnel0 in route table -BR will announce LANs under it, check the route table on CVG -CVG will push the LANs under it to BR, check the route table on BR -after vpn connection was setup, check the traffic forward via vpn from BR side based on route table -STA1 under BR ping a remote server in cloud -STA1 under BR ping a remote server behind CVG -BR ping a server in cloud -BR ping a server behind CVG

step.desc: Config CVG act as l3 VPN server; declare supper-net for br1.mgt0, mgt0.1, mgt0.2
step.telnet: -v "save vpn ee-cert tftp://${pub.tftp1.tip}:certs/server_cert.pem" -v "save vpn private-key tftp://${pub.tftp1.tip}:certs/server_key.pem" -v "vpn xauth-client-list ${vpn.client.list} local" -v "vpn xauth-client-list ${vpn.client.list} client-name ${br1.br.name} password aerohive" -v "vpn server-ipsec-tunnel ${vpn.server.name} vpn-mode layer-3" -v "vpn ipsec-tunnel ${vpn.server.name} client-list ${vpn.client.list}" -v "vpn tunnel-policy vpn_tunnel_policy server ipsec-tunnel ${vpn.server.name}" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br1.br.mgt0.ip}/${br.mgt0.supermask}" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.mgt0.supermask}" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip}/${br.mgt0.supermask}"

step.desc: Enable OSPF on eth1 if it has two arms
step.telnet: -v "routing protocol ospf advertise eth1" -v "routing protocol ospf router-id ${cvg1.cvg.lan.ip}" -v "routing protocol type ospf" -v "routing protocol enable"

step.desc: config mgt0.1 with dhcp service enable
step.telnet: -v "interface mgt0.1 vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface mgt0.1 ip ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server enable"

step.desc: config mgt0.2 with dhcp service enable
step.telnet: -v "interface mgt0.2 vlan ${br1.vpc2.vlan}" -v "interface mgt0.2 ip ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "interface mgt0.2 dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface mgt0.2 dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface mgt0.2 dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.2 dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.2 dhcp-server enable"

step.desc: config BR as l3 VPN client
step.telnet: -v "save vpn ca-cert tftp://${pub.tftp1.tip}:certs/cacert.pem" -v "vpn client-ipsec-tunnel ${br1.br.name}_ipsec_1 vpn-mode layer-3" -v "vpn ipsec-tunnel ${br1.br.name}_ipsec_1 gateway ${cvg1.cvg.tunnel.ip} client-name ${br1.br.name} password aerohive" -v "vpn tunnel-policy vpn_tunnel_policy client ipsec-tunnel ${br1.br.name}_ipsec_1 primary" -v "routing route-request enable" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br1.br.mgt0.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "routing internal-sub-network ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}"

step.desc: config BR eth1 port as bridge-access vlan br1.vpc1.vlan, eth2 trunk mode with native-vlan br1.vpc1.vlan, all mac-learning enable
step.telnet: -v "user-profile lan_eth1 qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id ${br1.vpc1.vlan} attribute ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "user-profile lan_eth2 qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id ${br1.vpc2.vlan} attribute ${br1.vpc2.vlan}" -v "interface eth1 mode bridge-access user-profile-attribute ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface eth2 mode bridge-802.1q" -v "int eth2 native-vlan ${br1.vpc2.vlan}" -v "int eth1 mac-learning enable" -v "int eth2 mac-learning enable"

step.desc: check vpn ike sa on BR side destination to public address of the CVG behind FW
check vpn ike sa on CVG side destination to public address of the BR
show vpn ike sp
check gre tunnel on br side remote to CVG wan, local to BR mgt0, gateway to CVG public addr
check gre tunnel on cvg side local to CVG wan addr
br1.vpc1 get ip addr from dhcp server on BR mgt0.1
set br1.vpc1.tif.ip var for vpc1 on BR side
set var to descript CVG lan route
CVG will push its mgt0 ip address and lans to BR
set var to descript CVG lan route
set var to descript CVG lan route
set var to descript CVG lan route

stage.step:
BR will push its mgt0 ip address to CVG, BR will announce LANs under it, check the route table on CVG step6.1_show_route_cvg_01.log
-v "show ip route"
-p 1 -i "${br1.br.mgt0.ip}" -p 3 -i "255.255.255.255" -p 8 -i "tunnel0" -p 1 -i "${br1.br.mgt0.route}" -p 8 -i "tunnel0" -p 1 -i "${br1.br.mgt0.1.route}" -p 8 -i "tunnel0" -p 1 -i "${br1.br.mgt0.2.route}" -p 8 -i "tunnel0">

step.desc: enable debug on BR
step.telnet: -v "_ff id 1 src-ip ${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} protocol 1 bidirectional" -v "_ff id 2 dst-ip ${cvg1.vpc1.tif.ip} protocol 1 bidirectional" -v "_ff id 3 protocol 47 bidirectional" -v "_ff id 4 protocol 50 bidirectional" -v "_kdebug fe basic" -v "_kdebug fe detail" -v "clear log buffered"

step.desc: Server behind CVG ping br1.vpc1
show log buf
show br log buf
BR ping a server behind CVG
show br log buf
enable debug on CVG
step.telnet: -v "no _ff id 2" -v "_ff id 2 dst-ip ${pub.dns1.ip} protocol 1 bidirectional" -v "_kdebug fe basic" -v "_kdebug fe detail"

step.desc: BR ping a server in cloud(internet)
show br log buf
show br log buf
